page.title: 06Wendover Market
page.content: A Charter in 1400 granted Wendover a Thursday market and after an absence of many years it was re-introduced in May 1983 proving to be a popular addition to the village. People scurrying to and fro across the Manor Waste. Traders selling their wares- Fishmongers, Butchers. Bargaining! Arguing! The place of a thousand cries, Mingling with the jolly music of a fiddler, cap on ground. Dusk falls, and the last customers wander home. The noise dies and stalls are dismantled as an evening mist creeps over the Chiltern Hills. A lone sparrow pecks at a crumb - all that is left on the ancient cobbles to show where the Thursday market has been!
